thread.title: Theresa May and Donald Trump held hands and everyone’s grossed out
thread.title_full: Theresa May and Donald Trump held hands and everyone’s grossed out

author: ashithanagesh
title: Theresa May and Donald Trump held hands and everyone’s grossed out
text:
What is happening here (Picture: EPA) Theresa May met Donald Trump at the White House yesterday, and… something weird happened.
They held hands. The Prime Minister of the Great Britain and Northern Ireland and the President of the United States held hands .
Three women plied footballer with booze then sexually assaulted him with vegetables Apart from it being completely unsettling, gross, and a disturbing show of dominance from Trump (would he have held David Cameron’s hand?), it’s also kind of funny in a really odd way.
So obviously everyone woke up on Saturday morning and spat out their alka seltzer when they saw the photos of Trump and May getting intimate – and then they tweeted.
the new best exotic marigold hotel film looks shit pic.twitter.com/RzkfgYAuiz 
— TechnicallyRon (@TechnicallyRon) January 27, 2017 
Donald Trump and Theresa May holding hands is enough to make my vagina dry for the next three centuries
— a hoe but lonely ☭ (@darthellen) January 27, 2017 
It really is a special relationship! Donald Trump and Theresa May walking outside the White House holding hands! pic.twitter.com/AsYcDVsugp 
— Matt Dathan (@matt_dathan) January 27, 2017 
Donald Trump and Theresa May photographed holding hands. I assume they're thinking of adopting Nigel Farage?
— ReallyTiredGeek (@RTGraves) January 28, 2017 
Donald Trump & Theresa May holding hands remind anyone of that Simpsons Halloween episode where the Aliens took over? Yeh, we're doomed pic.twitter.com/ExpRgOQumN 
— Safwan Ahmedmia (@SuperSaf) January 27, 2017 
It was all over the front pages too, with papers referring to the ‘new special relationship’ GUARDIAN FRONT PAGE: ‘The new special relationship' #skypapers pic.twitter.com/pv21Z8YDwe 
— Sky News (@SkyNews) January 27, 2017 
Tomorrow's @theipaper front page: The special relationship is back on #tomorrowspaperstoday pic.twitter.com/IkSxXcr2xS 
— i newspaper (@theipaper) January 27, 2017 
EXPRESS: Hand in Hand United We Stand #tomorrowspaperstoday pic.twitter.com/pISzDyiFzx 
— Neil Henderson (@hendopolis) January 27, 2017 
FT WEEKEND: Trump hands May the promise of 'stronger' special relationship #tomorrowspaperstoday pic.twitter.com/tcH8m2HdXh 
— Neil Henderson (@hendopolis) January 27, 2017 
Including this particularly gross headline from the Telegraph TELEGRAPH: Hand in hand, the happy couple #tomorrowspaperstoday pic.twitter.com/7cWgw41L5R 
— Neil Henderson (@hendopolis) January 27, 2017 
And this one from the Daily Mail. Blergh MAIL: Love-in at the White House #tomorrowspaperstoday pic.twitter.com/axmkE9Uogo 
— Neil Henderson (@hendopolis) January 27, 2017 
And this one from the Mirror… Ew MIRROR: I wanna hold your hand #tomorrowspaperstoday pic.twitter.com/2kQoBIOwOo 
— Neil Henderson (@hendopolis) January 27, 2017 

Gross. Gross gross gross and weird.
The visit itself, however, was for all intents and purposes a success.
Hundreds of London tube ads hacked to protest 'secret' deportations May managed to achieve her stated aims of reaffirming the special relationship, and confirming both countries’ ‘unshakeable commitment’ to Nato – something that, given Trump’s previous statements on the matter, was not a given.
However, her detractors will no doubt criticise her for not taking a stronger stance on issues on which the UK differs significantly with Trump – namely the use of extreme torture methods, anti-immigration and anti-refugee laws, what is effectively a ban on people from Muslim-majority countries, and women’s rights.
